graphicslib3D

Class Polygon3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • graphicslib3D.Polygon3D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Polygon3D
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    Defines a 3D polygon which includes a Vertex list and Plane Coefficients. The VertexList of a Polygon3D is made up of Vertex3D objects representing the polygon vertices. The plane coefficients of the polygon are stored as doubles, and can be retrieved individually or via the XYZW components of a Point3D object. Note: plane coefficients default to 0.0, and remain so until at least three vertices have been added to the polygon. Thereafter, the plane coefficients are updated after each new vertex is added. Newell's method is used to compute plane coefficients.
    Author:
    John Clevenger, based on an earlier version by William Dimaculangan, and extended by Monika Jankun
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Polygon3D()
      Creates a polygon with an empty vertex list and plane coefficients whose values are all zero.

      • Polygon3D

        public Polygon3D()

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Returns an Object which is a deep clone of this Polygon3D.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

      • getVertices

        public java.util.Vector getVertices()
        Returns a new Vector containing copies (clones) of the vertices of this polygon, if any, in the same order as in the polygon vertex list. If the vertex list of the polygon exists but is empty then an empty Vector is returned. If the vertex list is itself null (as opposed to being empty) then null is returned.

      • setNewVertexList

        public void setNewVertexList(java.util.Vector<Vertex3D> newVertexList)
        Saves the specified Vector as the new vertex list of this polygon. If the new vertex list contains at least three vertices then the plane coefficients of the polygon are updated to match the new vertices; otherwise the plane coefficients are all set to 0.0. The old vertex list is discarded.

      • getPlaneCoefficients

        public Point3D getPlaneCoefficients()
        Returns a new Point3D object whose XYZW values are the same as the ABCD plane coefficient values of this polygon, unless the plane coefficients are undefined (for example because the polygon has fewer than 3 vertices), in which case returns NULL.

      • getA

        public double getA()
        Returns the value of the plane coefficient A of this polygon. Note that it is legal for any one plane coefficient to be zero; hence, this method always returns a value. However, if all four coefficients are zero then it implies the polygon is undefined (has fewer than 3 vertices). It is the application's responsibility to check for this.

      • getB

        public double getB()
        Returns the value of the plane coefficient B of this polygon. Note that it is legal for any one plane coefficient to be zero; hence, this method always returns a value. However, if all four coefficients are zero then it implies the polygon is undefined (has fewer than 3 vertices). It is the application's responsibility to check for this.

      • getC

        public double getC()
        Returns the value of the plane coefficient C of this polygon. Note that it is legal for any one plane coefficient to be zero; hence, this method always returns a value. However, if all four coefficients are zero then it implies the polygon is undefined (has fewer than 3 vertices). It is the application's responsibility to check for this.

      • getD

        public double getD()
        Returns the value of the plane coefficient D of this polygon. Note that it is legal for any one plane coefficient to be zero; hence, this method always returns a value. However, if all four coefficients are zero then it implies the polygon is undefined (has fewer than 3 vertices). It is the application's responsibility to check for this.

      • setPlaneCoefficients

        public void setPlaneCoefficients(Point3D newCoeffs)
        Deprecated. Applications should not use this method since there is no way to assure correspondence between plane coefficients and vertex values if the coefficients can be set independently.
        Sets new values for the plane coefficients of this polygon. The new plane coefficient values ABCD are taken from the XYZW components of the specified Point3D object.

      • setPlaneCoefficients

        public void setPlaneCoefficients(double newA,
                                 double newB,
                                 double newC,
                                 double newD)
        Deprecated. Applications should not use this method since there is no way to assure correspondence between plane coefficients and vertex values if the coefficients can be set independently.
        Sets new values for the plane coefficients of this polygon.

      • setA

        public void setA(double newA)
        Deprecated. Applications should not use this method since there is no way to assure correspondence between plane coefficients and vertex values if the coefficients can be set independently.
        Sets new value for the plane coefficient A of this polygon.

      • setB

        public void setB(double newB)
        Deprecated. Applications should not use this method since there is no way to assure correspondence between plane coefficients and vertex values if the coefficients can be set independently.
        Sets new value for the plane coefficient B of this polygon.

      • setC

        public void setC(double newC)
        Deprecated. Applications should not use this method since there is no way to assure correspondence between plane coefficients and vertex values if the coefficients can be set independently.
        Sets new value for the plane coefficient C of this polygon.

      • setD

        public void setD(double newD)
        Deprecated. Applications should not use this method since there is no way to assure correspondence between plane coefficients and vertex values if the coefficients can be set independently.
        Sets a new value for the plane coefficient D of this polygon.

      • addVertex

        public void addVertex(Vertex3D newVertex)
        Creates a copy of the specified Vertex3D object and adds it to the tail of the vertex list of this Polygon3D. If the resulting vertex list contains at least three vertices then the plane coefficients of the polygon are automatically updated using Newell's method.

      • addVertex

        public void addVertex(Point3D aPoint3D)
        Uses the specified Point3D to create a new Vertex3D object and adds the Vertex3D to the tail of the vertex list of this Polygon3D. The new Vertex3D is created by passing the input Point3D to the constructor Vertex3D(Point3D). The new Vertex3D is added to the Polygon3D vertex list by invoking the method addVertex(Vertex3D), meaning the vertex is added to the tail of the vertex list and the polygon plane coefficients are updated as appropriate.

      • insertVertex

        public void insertVertex(Vertex3D newVertex)
        Creates a copy of the specified Vertex3D object and inserts it at the head of the vertex list of this Polygon3D. If the resulting vertex list contains at least three vertices then the plane coefficients of the polygon are automatically updated using Newell's method.

      • insertVertex

        public void insertVertex(Point3D aPoint3D)
        Uses the specified Point3D to create a new Vertex3D object and inserts the Vertex3D at the head of the vertex list of this Polygon3D. The new Vertex3D is created by passing the input Point3D to the constructor Vertex3D(Point3D). The new Vertex3D is added to the Polygon3D vertex list by invoking the method insertVertex(Vertex3D), meaning the vertex is added to the head of the vertex list and the polygon's plane coefficients are updated as appropriate.

      • setColor

        public void setColor(java.awt.Color c)
        Changes the Color RGB member of each of the Vertex3D objects in this polygon's vertexList. If the vertex list is null or empty, the method silently takes no action.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a printable representation of this Polygon.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
